summary: This is an email chain from August 2020 regarding the coordination of victim assistance in the Epstein investigation. It involves FBI Victim Specialists and a DOJ official coordinating contact with victims.

persons.name: Stacie
persons.context: A Victim Specialist in the New York Field Office involved with the victim assistance side of the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: ALALLEN2
persons.context: A Victim Assistance Program Manager in the Victim Services Division at FBIHQ, involved with victim assistance for the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Associate Deputy Attorney General
persons.role: DOJ National Child Exploitation & Human Trafficking Coordinator
persons.context: An Associate Deputy Attorney General and the DOJ National Child Exploitation & Human Trafficking Coordinator, coordinating upcoming contact with victims of Epstein.

connections.description: Both are FBI personnel involved with victim assistance for the Epstein investigation.
The DOJ official is coordinating upcoming contact with victims and requested the FBI Victim Specialist's information.
The DOJ official is coordinating victim assistance efforts with the FBIHQ Victim Assistance Program Manager.

events.title: Coordination of Victim Contact
events.description: DOJ and FBI officials are coordinating upcoming contact with victims of Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: 290 (likely an address or building number mentioned)
keyFacts: The FBI and DOJ were actively coordinating victim assistance for the Epstein investigation as of August 2020.
A DOJ Associate Deputy Attorney General served as the National Child Exploitation & Human Trafficking Coordinator.
The email indicates planned contact with victims of Jeffrey Epstein was being organized.
The correspondence shows inter-agency coordination between the FBI's Victim Services Division and the DOJ.
